document.heading: Recreation Volunteer Background Check and Screening Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-123, the “Recreation Volunteer Background Check and Screening Act of 2000,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-303, which was referred to the Committee on Education, Libraries and Recreation. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 4, 2000, and February 1, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 23, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-289 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-123 became effective on May 23, 2000.
